body_html:
This sounds like a problem we recently had in a unit test on Windows. The solution was to close file handles in a summary writer cache that were still open. You can see the solution here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/9281/files

Can you verify that calling FileWriterCache.clear() before trying to remove the directory works? Try it at head -- #9185 will probably have to be in your code for this to work properly.

We considered doing this automatically after each Estimator.train() run -- but that seemed too much long term interference. However, it would make a lot of sense to do it in Experiment.train_and_evaluate and similar methods.
body_text:
This sounds like a problem we recently had in a unit test on Windows. The solution was to close file handles in a summary writer cache that were still open. You can see the solution here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/9281/files
Can you verify that calling FileWriterCache.clear() before trying to remove the directory works? Try it at head -- #9185 will probably have to be in your code for this to work properly.
We considered doing this automatically after each Estimator.train() run -- but that seemed too much long term interference. However, it would make a lot of sense to do it in Experiment.train_and_evaluate and similar methods.
body:
This sounds like a problem we recently had in a unit test on Windows. The solution was to close file handles in a summary writer cache that were still open. You can see the solution here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/9281/files

Can you verify that calling `FileWriterCache.clear()` before trying to remove the directory works? Try it at head -- #9185 will probably have to be in your code for this to work properly.

We considered doing this automatically after each `Estimator.train()` run -- but that seemed too much long term interference. However, it would make a lot of sense to do it in `Experiment.train_and_evaluate` and similar methods.
